name: Snow Report 2026-02-20 18:48:34
report:
Good afternoon, Pico family, 

It's hammering on the mountain! We've already received over three inches of fresh powder and the storm is just getting started, just in time for the weekend. We're expecting another 4-8" inches of the fluffy stuff tonight, and another 1-2" during the day on Saturday. Temps will be sitting comfortably in the low to mid 20s, falling slightly throughout the day. Get ready for good times and fresh tracks!

Conditions have been skiing and riding great, and they’re only getting better. There will be lots of powder to be found across the mountain, and you’ll be able to sink those edges deep on groomed terrain. As the day goes on, freshly groomed runs will transition from a smooth surface into soft packed powder, which will remain fun and forgiving. By the end of the day, there will be plenty of moguls to enjoy, especially on trails like Wrangler, Lift Line, and A Slope.

Our grooming team will be laying down the cord tonight through the storm, providing a solid package of groomers for the morning. Expressway, Triple Slope, and Fool’s Gold are my go-to choices for cruiser laps. For a full list of groomed trails, head to our Lifts & Trails Report.

Lift Status Update: 
Our lift maintenance team has been working through the night to install the fabricated part for Summit Express. However, they encountered additional unexpected challenges and will need to continue work tomorrow morning, Feb 21, before we can re-open Summit Express Quad. 

Due to the increased business levels we expect at Killington Resort tomorrow, we will not be proactively calling the Summit Guarantee at this time. We will provide an update on the status of Summit Express by mid-morning. If a decision is made to activate the Summit Guarantee, depending on the outlook of Summit and capacity at Killington, we will communicate that at that time. 

Please note that the decision to implement the Summit Guarantee is at the sole discretion of Killington Resort/Pico Mountain leadership team. This policy does not serve as a guarantee that it will be put into effect each time the Summit Express Quad is out of service. 

The Outpost Double experienced a more significant mechanical failure on Wednesday, February 18, involving the lift’s drive shaft. Outpost is a 1969 Carlevaro-Savio fixed-grip double chairlift. It is considered an “orphan lift,” meaning the original manufacturer is no longer in operation. Because of this, replacement parts are extremely limited and must be specially sourced or custom fabricated. Due to the age of the lift and the complexity of sourcing components, the Outpost Double will be down for an extended period. There is currently no estimated timeline for its return to service.

We understand lift downtime impacts your experience, and we appreciate your patience as our mountain operations team works to resolve these issues. We will continue to share updates as more information becomes available.

Have a great weekend, Pico Family! 

– Austin

Period of 7 days/week lift operations: February 16th - March 2nd. 

Key lifts operate Monday, Thursday, & Friday from 9:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. On Saturday & Sunday, key lifts operate from 8:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. 

Uphill Travel 

  • Pico Base to the top of Golden Express Quad - Open
  • Pico Base to Pico Summit - Open
  • Summit Glade Route - Open
  • Killington/Pico Mountain Interconnect – Open

Before heading up the hill, be sure to review our uphill travel policies and grab your Uphill Travel Pass here. All uphill travelers are required to have an Uphill Travel Pass and armband, which can be picked up at any ticket window. Please keep an eye out for grooming equipment and steer clear of mountain ops during non-operating hours.            

Mountain Services 

  • Breakfast: Served every day that lifts are spinning in the Pico Cafeteria (2nd floor) starting at 8:30 a.m. on weekdays and at 8:00 a.m. on weekends/peak dates. Menu includes egg sandwiches and our new signature breakfast burritos.
  • Lunch: Served every day that lifts are spinning in the Pico Cafeteria (2nd floor). Menu includes our full grill menu of burgers, tenders, veggie burgers, and more, plus Caesar salads that are made to order.
  • Last Run Lounge (3rd floor): Open every day that lifts are spinning. Bar service is available from 11:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Menu includes soups, garlic knots, and lite fare, with our pizza station opening up on weekends and busier days. Convenient QR code ordering is available.
  • Guest Services, Rentals, and Pico Sports Shop: Open every day that lifts are spinning from 30 minutes before lifts open until 30 minutes after lifts close.

Tickets & Lessons 

  • Tickets are on sale at picomountain.com and must be purchased online. My Pico 2025/2026 Season Passes are still on sale!
  • Group lessons are available! Click here for more information. All lessons and rentals must also be booked online.
  • For information on cancellation and change policies, please visit picomountain.com/cancellation 

Pico Fitness Center                            

Visit picomountain.com/fitness to see our fitness class schedule for the winter, plus more details about memberships and pool lane reservations.    

Hours of Operation: 

Monday thru Friday: 6:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m. 
Saturday & Sunday: 8:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.        

We strive to have the most up-to-date and accurate snow report, but errors can happen from time to time. If you have feedback or a correction for us, please share it here.

name: Snow Report 2026-02-20 05:54:20
report:
Good morning, Pico family, 

It was another beautiful one yesterday with bright blue skies and sunshine lighting up the hill. We’ve got some exciting stuff on the way as snow moves in this afternoon, with flakes starting to fall after 2 p.m. Breezy east winds will join, and temperatures will reach the mid-20s at the summit and upper 20s at the base. We’re keeping an eye on the storm that could bring 8 to 12 inches of fresh snow from this afternoon through Saturday night. Fresh tracks could be a part of your weekend plans!

Conditions have been skiing and riding great. Yesterday’s surfaces offered dependable grip with a soft, playful feel thanks to the sunshine and slightly warmer temps. Our groomed trails are smooth and confidence-inspiring, ideal for carving easy arcs or picking up the pace. As the day goes on, those freshly groomed runs transition into soft packed and packed powder surfaces that stay fun and forgiving.

Our grooming team focused on the lower mountain and added That-a-Way to the package of groomers. Hit up Gold Rush to Swinger for a nice long stretch of corduroy to practice those carves. For a full list of groomed trails, head to our Lifts & Trails Report.

We want to keep you informed on two recent lift issues. The Summit Express Quad has been down since Tuesday, February 17, due to a failed keystone sheave, a critical component that guides and supports the haul rope. Our lift maintenance team quickly diagnosed the issue and are working with an outside entity to fabricate the rare part fabricated from scratch. We are optimistic that the Summit Express Quad will be ready to operate Saturday and should be in good shape heading into the weekend.  

The Outpost Double experienced a more significant mechanical failure on Wednesday, February 18, involving the lift’s drive shaft. Outpost is a 1969 Carlevaro-Savio fixed grip double chairlift. It is considered an “orphan lift,” meaning the original manufacturer is no longer in operation. Because of this, replacement parts are extremely limited and must be specially sourced or custom fabricated.  Due to the age of the lift and the complexity of sourcing components, the Outpost Double will be down for an extended period. There is currently no estimated timeline for its return to service.  

We understand lift downtime impacts your experience, and we appreciate your patience as our mountain operations team works to resolve these issues. We will continue to share updates as more information becomes available. 

The Bonanza Carpet, Golden Express Quad, Knomes Knoll Triple, and Little Pico Triple will begin spinning at 9:00 a.m. Please note that the Outpost Double and Summit Quad are currently closed for repairs. We apologize for any inconvenience and will provide updates as soon as they become available.

Have a fun Friday! 

– Evan

Period of 7 days/week lift operations: February 16th - March 2nd. 

Key lifts operate Monday, Thursday, & Friday from 9:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. On Saturday & Sunday, key lifts operate from 8:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.

  • Pico Base to the top of Golden Express Quad - Open
  • Pico Base to Pico Summit - Open
  • Summit Glade Route - Open
  • Killington/Pico Mountain Interconnect – Open

Before heading up the hill, be sure to review our uphill travel policies and grab your Uphill Travel Pass here. All uphill travelers are required to have an Uphill Travel Pass and armband, which can be picked up at any ticket window. Please keep an eye out for grooming equipment and steer clear of mountain ops during non-operating hours.            

Mountain Services 

  • Breakfast: Served every day that lifts are spinning in the Pico Cafeteria (2nd floor) starting at 8:30 a.m. on weekdays and at 8:00 a.m. on weekends/peak dates. Menu includes egg sandwiches and our new signature breakfast burritos.
  • Lunch: Served every day that lifts are spinning in the Pico Cafeteria (2nd floor). Menu includes our full grill menu of burgers, tenders, veggie burgers, and more, plus Caesar salads that are made to order.
  • Last Run Lounge (3rd floor): Open every day that lifts are spinning. Bar service is available from 11:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Menu includes soups, garlic knots, and lite fare, with our pizza station opening up on weekends and busier days. Convenient QR code ordering is available.
  • Guest Services, Rentals, and Pico Sports Shop: Open every day that lifts are spinning from 30 minutes before lifts open until 30 minutes after lifts close.

Tickets & Lessons 

  • Tickets are on sale at picomountain.com and must be purchased online. My Pico 2025/2026 Season Passes are still on sale!
  • Group lessons are available! Click here for more information. All lessons and rentals must also be booked online.
  • For information on cancellation and change policies, please visit picomountain.com/cancellation 

Pico Fitness Center                            

Visit picomountain.com/fitness to see our fitness class schedule for the winter, plus more details about memberships and pool lane reservations.    

Hours of Operation:

Saturday & Sunday: 8:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.

name: Snow Report 2026-02-19 05:53:54
report:
Good morning, Pico family, 

The conditions were a blast yesterday. Soft, edgeable snow made every turn feel smooth and confident, and the sunshine was the perfect finishing touch. We’ll have more of those great surfaces waiting for you today, and with 100% of our trails open, there’s plenty of terrain to explore from top to bottom.

Mostly sunny skies are on tap, with a high near 29° at the base and 24° at the peak. Light winds out of the northeast will shift southwest in the afternoon, keeping things comfortable as you chase the sun.

The recent warmer temps softened things up, creating ideal surfaces for smooth turns and easy sliding. Knomes Knoll is on fire right now, with a little bit of everything to keep things interesting. Whether you’re looking to carve, cruise, or mix it up, there’s plenty out there to enjoy. 

Our grooming team got over 20 trails, leaving behind perfect corduroy. Head over to Fool’s Gold for that early morning carving or to Triple Slope for a nice relaxing run. For a full list of groomed trails, head to our Lifts & Trails Report.

The Bonanza Carpet, Golden Express Quad, Knomes Knoll Triple, and Little Pico Triple will begin spinning at 9:00 a.m. Please note that the Outpost Double and Summit Quad are currently closed for repairs. We apologize for any inconvenience and will provide updates as soon as they become available.

See out there for more fun!

– Evan

 

Period of 7 days/week lift operations: February 16th - March 2nd. 

Key lifts operate Monday, Thursday, & Friday from 9:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. On Saturday & Sunday, key lifts operate from 8:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.

name: Snow Report 2026-02-18 05:58:09
report:
Good morning, Pico family! 

The sun dipped behind the clouds yesterday, but we got an additional inch of snow in the morning to make up for it. Temps stayed mild, the snow got softer, and it started to feel like spring for a bit out there. Today's feel should switch back towards winter, but nothing too crazy. 

Temps will float in the mid 20s at our base, with peak temperatures settling in the lower 20s. Winds will pick up in the morning but settle down by the afternoon, and it shouldn’t feel too cold out there overall. Some more snow is looking to roll in around the time lifts stop spinning, with hopefully 1-3" waiting for us by the time Thursday morning comes around. 

The Summit Guarantee is in effect today as the Summit Quad remains under mechanical repair. The Knomes Knoll Triple will run in its place. If we are able to get that lift running later in the day, we will be sure to update you here. Please note that the Outpost Double is on hold due to a mechanical issue with no time estimate. 

Snow surfaces will harden up a bit from yesterday, but nothing looks to become bulletproof overnight, as temps won’t dip too far below freezing all day. Softer snow will likely pop up more at lower elevations, and groomed surfaces will continue to deliver the goods for anyone. On the grooming front, our crew stayed off of Lower Giant Killer, Stampede, and Charlie’s Highway to protect coverage and keep things from not getting too firm. A Slope has been a lot of fun since receiving plenty of snowmaking coverage, and Triple Slope is always a classic option if you make it towards Knomes. For a full list of groomed trails, head to our Lifts & Trails Report.

We’re as excited as you are that we’ll be back again today for Wednesday(!) action. The Bonanza Carpet, Golden Express Quad, and Little Pico Triple will begin spinning at 9:00 a.m. The Outpost Double will follow soon after at 9:30 a.m.

See you out there! 

- Evan

  

Period of 7 days/week lift operations: February 16th - March 2nd.

name: Snow Report 2026-02-17 16:25:06
report:
Good evening, Pico family! 

The sun dipped behind the clouds for today, but we got an additional inch of snow in the morning to make up for it. Temps stayed mild, the snow got softer, and it started to feel like spring for a bit out there. Tomorrow’s feel should switch back towards winter, but nothing too crazy. 

Temps will float in the mid 20s at our base tomorrow, with peak temperatures settling in the lower 20s. Winds will pick up in the morning but settle down by the afternoon, and it shouldn’t feel too cold out there overall. Some more snow is looking to roll in around the time lifts stop spinning tomorrow, with hopefully 1-3" waiting for us by the time Thursday morning comes around. 

After our Summit Express Quad was down today for mechanical repairs, we are hoping to have it running again at some point tomorrow, but we’ll have further updates on that front in the morning. We appreciate your understanding and apologize for any inconvenience. 

Snow surfaces will harden up a bit from yesterday, but nothing looks to become bulletproof overnight, as temps won’t dip too far below freezing all day. Softer snow will likely pop up more at lower elevations, and groomed surfaces will continue to deliver the goods for anyone. On the grooming front, our crew is staying off of Lower Giant Killer, Stampede, and Charlie’s Highway to protect coverage and keep things from not getting too firm. A Slope has been a lot of fun since receiving plenty of snowmaking coverage, and Triple Slope is always a classic option if you make it towards Knomes. For a full list of groomed trails, head to our Lifts & Trails Report.

We’re as excited as you are that we’ll be back again tomorrow for Wednesday(!) Pico action. The Bonanza Carpet, Golden Express Quad, and Little Pico Triple will begin spinning at 9:00 a.m. The Outpost Double will follow soon after at 9:30 a.m., and we’ll provide updates in the morning about the Summit Express & if the Knomes Knoll Triple will run in its place tomorrow. 

Have a great night! 

- Cullen

  • Pico Base to the top of Golden Express Quad - Open

  • Pico Base to Pico Summit - Open 

  • Summit Glade Route - Open 

  • Killington/Pico Mountain Interconnect – Open    

Before heading up the hill, be sure to review our uphill travel policies and grab your Uphill Travel Pass here. All uphill travelers are required to have an Uphill Travel Pass and armband, which can be picked up at any ticket window. Please keep an eye out for grooming equipment and steer clear of mountain ops during non-operating hours.            

Mountain Services 

  • Breakfast: Served each day that lifts are spinning in the Pico Cafeteria (2nd floor) starting at 8:30 a.m. on weekdays and at 8:00 a.m. on weekends/peak dates. 

    • Menu includes egg sandwiches and our new signature breakfast burritos. 

  • Lunch: Served each day that lifts are spinning in the Pico Cafeteria (2nd floor). 

    • Menu includes our full grill menu of burgers, tenders, veggie burgers, and more, plus Caesar salads that are made to order. 

  • Last Run Lounge (3rd floor): Open every day that lifts are spinning. Bar service is available from 11:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. 

    • Menu includes soups, garlic knots, and lite fare, with our pizza station opening up on weekends and busier days. Convenient QR code ordering is available. 

  • Guest Services, Rentals, and Pico Sports Shop: Open each day that lifts are spinning from 30 minutes before start spinning until 30 minutes after lifts close. 

Tickets & Lessons 

  • Tickets are on sale at picomountain.com and must be purchased online. My Pico 2025/2026 Season Passes are still on sale!

  • Group lessons are available! Click here for more information. All lessons and rentals must also be booked online. 

  • For information on cancellation and change policies, please visit picomountain.com/cancellation 

Pico Fitness Center                            

Visit picomountain.com/fitness to see our fitness class schedule for the winter, plus more details about memberships and pool lane reservations.    

Hours of Operation: 

Monday thru Friday: 6:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m. 
Saturday & Sunday: 8:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.        

We strive to have the most up-to-date and accurate snow report, but errors can happen from time to time. If you have feedback or a correction for us, please share it here.

name: Snow Report 2026-02-17 08:45:04
report:
Good morning, Pico fam!

What a beautiful President’s Day it turned out to be. Comfortable temps, a soft breeze, and great visibility made for a fantastic day of turns across a 100% open hill. Today looks like much of the same!

If you're lucky enough to make it on the hill today, expect mostly cloudy skies with highs in the mid to upper 20s up top and low 30s at the base. Winds will be on the lighter side, generally 10–15 mph out of the west. There’s a chance for light, showery precipitation during the day, mainly snow, with a slight mix possible at lower elevations. We already had some light, fluffy stuff coming down this morning before lifts started spinning! The moderating temps should help surfaces soften up nicely through the afternoon.

Snow surfaces are still fantastic all over the place. From LPT to Outpost and Knomes, there's something for everyone. Conditions are great on recently groomed Outpost runs like Bronco and Wrangler, while more compact runs like Poma Woods and Lift Line are still seeing plenty of coverage. Groomed terrain continues to deliver smooth turns, with a few isolated slick spots here and there at higher elevation. With the slightly warmer air, expect a little more give under your edges as the afternoon rolls around.

Our grooming team stuck with much of their usual plan overnight, with trails like Ace of Clubs and Triple Slope getting a groom off of Knomes and each of the trails off of Golden getting some love. C-Slope, Summit Glades, and Home Run between A-Slope and B-Slope were not groomed to preserve snow cover, but there's still plenty of cover to be had for normal skiing & riding. Be sure to check the Lifts & Trails Report for the full lineup before heading out.

Hopefully you know this by now if you're reading this, but it's still here’s something we don’t say often… we’re open on a Tuesday! Bonus midweek action means prime opportunity for some Tuesday turns today.

The follow lifts will begin spinning at 9:00 a.m. today:

  • Bonanza Carpet
  • Golden Express Quad
  • Little Pico Triple
  • Knomes Knoll Triple

The Outpost Double will follow at 9:30 a.m. Please note, The Summit Express Quad will not operate today due to a mechanical issue. All Pico Season Passholders and Lift Tickets valid on Tuesday will be honored at Killington for no additional fee. Guests with valid Pico tickets and passes can proceed directly to the lifts at Killington. Thank you for your understanding. 

Looking ahead, we’re keeping an eye on multiple chances for snow later this week and into the weekend, enough to keep things fresh as we roll through this strong stretch of winter.

Hope to see you out there today!

- Cullen

 

Period of 7 days/week lift operations: February 16th - March 2nd.

Key lifts operate Monday, Thursday, & Friday from 9:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. On Saturday & Sunday, key lifts operate from 8:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.

Uphill Travel                 

  • Pico Base to the top of Golden Express Quad - Open
  • Pico Base to Pico Summit - Open
  • Summit Glade Route - Open
  • Killington/Pico Mountain Interconnect – Open   

All uphill travelers are required to have an Uphill Travel Pass and armband, which can be picked up at any ticket window. Before heading up the hill, be sure to review our uphill travel policies and grab your pass here. Please keep an eye out for grooming equipment and steer clear of mountain ops during non-operating hours.                

Mountain Services:                     

  • Pico Cafeteria is open every day that lifts are spinning, serving breakfast and lunch. Open 30 minutes before lifts are open.
  • Last Run Lounge on the third floor is open every day that lifts are spinning from 11:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m.          
  • Guest Services at the ticket windows, Rentals, and Pico Sports Retail Shop are open 30 minutes before and after lifts.               
  • Group lessons are now available. Click here for more information.            
  • For information on cancellation and change policies, please visit picomountain.com/cancellation.        

Additional Food & Beverage Info:               

The Pico Cafeteria breakfast service will include egg sandwiches and our new signature breakfast burritos. For lunch, we are offering our full grill menu of burgers, tenders, veggie burgers, and more, plus Caesar salads that are made to order. The Last Run Lounge serves soups, garlic knots, and lite fare, with our pizza station opening up on weekends and busier days.    

Tickets are on sale at picomountain.com and must be purchased online. My Pico 2025/2026 Season Passes are still on sale!    

Pico Fitness Center:                                    

Visit picomountain.com/fitness to see our fitness class schedule for the winter, plus more details about memberships and pool lane reservations.   

Hours of Operation   

Monday thru Friday: 6:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m.
Saturday & Sunday: 8:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m.       

We strive to have the most up-to-date and accurate snow report, but errors can happen from time to time. If you have feedback or a correction for us, please share it here.

name: Snow Report 2026-02-16 16:01:02
report:
Good afternoon, Pico family,

What a beautiful President’s Day it turned out to be. Comfortable temps, a soft breeze, and great visibility made for a fantastic day of turns across a 100% open hill. If you made it out today, you were rewarded.

We’ll carry that momentum right into tomorrow with another solid midwinter day on tap. Expect mostly cloudy skies with highs in the mid to upper 20s up top and low 30s at the base. Winds will be on the lighter side, generally 10–15 mph out of the west. There’s a chance for light, showery precipitation during the day, mainly snow, with a brief mix possible at lower elevations. In fact, the moderating temps should help surfaces soften up nicely through the afternoon.

Snow surfaces remain in a really good place. Groomed terrain continues to deliver that smooth, carve-friendly packed powder feel, with a few isolated slick spots here and there. With the slightly warmer air, expect a little more give under your edges while still holding onto that classic Pico consistency.

Our grooming team is sticking with the same plan as last night, with the exception of removing C-Slope, Summit Glades, and Homerun between A-Slope and B-Slope. Be sure to check the Lifts & Trails Report in the morning for the full lineup before heading out.

And here’s something we don’t say often… we’re open on a Tuesday! Bonus midweek action means prime opportunity for some Tuesday turns.

Lifts begin spinning tomorrow at 9:00 a.m. on:

  • Bonanza Carpet
  • Golden Express Quad
  • Little Pico Triple
  • Summit Express Quad

The Outpost Double will follow at 9:30 a.m.

Looking ahead, we’re keeping an eye on multiple chances for snow later this week and into the weekend, enough to keep things fresh as we roll through this strong stretch of winter.

More days, more turns, more time on snow. We’ll see you out there.

— Josh

 

Key lifts operate Monday, Thursday, & Friday from 9:00 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. On Saturday, & Sunday, key lifts operate from 8:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m.

Uphill Travel

  • Guest Services at the ticket windows, Rentals and Pico Sports Retail Shop are open 30 minutes before and after lifts.
